item.title: Tweet Pinboard: January 2018 - April 2018
item.description:
"When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure"https://t.co/AOKfuZwpSp

— Jonathan Korman 🔥 (@miniver) January 11, 2018

Three junior developers are performing higher than a pair of senior developers, which are all performing higher than one expert. That's how you play development poker? Let me show you my poker face.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 30, 2018

Terrible day. Parked my red Tesla convertible outside Cape Canaveral Space Center and I’m pretty sure it’s been towed.

— Tom Sutcliffe (@tds153) February 6, 2018

Sitting in a fast train driving in snow, which has 1st class coaches in the front, a restaurant in the middle and 2nd class coaches in the end, I think I would probably call this train: Snowpiercer.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) February 27, 2018

Someone needs to create a new social network. It offers the promise of hundreds new followers per day and thousands likes for whatever posts...
It's not a social network, it's social. That lets you be yourself. Hence the name *Vani* - True Social, meaning *Vanity*.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) February 28, 2018

Internal issue report lead time: the time from when a new issue is found by an internal employee to when it correctly gets reported to the right team.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 6, 2018

I treat testing as a way of giving feedback:
- Start to test earlier
- Keep tests small
- Perform testing often
I'm definitely not a fan of planning testing as a quality gate at the end of the development phase in order to decide releasing a huge feature or not.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 13, 2018

Black box, white box, transparent box, gray box... Time to think outside of the box

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 19, 2018

The fear of consequence will prevent people making mistakes? I doubt.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 21, 2018

Sometimes, we fear the unknown unknown. We are scared by the imagined monsters. However, the real frightening thing is: we don't know what we know.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 21, 2018

I heard "... Let's try harder to break it..."
I don't buy it and I keep my two cents:
1) Exhaustive testing is near impossible.
2) Testers usually don't break a thing. Testers find out what is broken.
3) Perfect quality is a unicorn.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 23, 2018

Looking at the photos I took years ago, although they are pretty "ugly" in image quality wise, they recorded some precious moments which I cannot recall without them. I feel lucky that I did take these "ugly" photos in the first place.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 23, 2018

I reset my fb passwd bc I'm curious what's happening here:
It looks like a huge cemetery of zombie. A golden 🏖️ is nearby. Some stylish friends are 🤳 on the beach. Bots appear everywhere throwing trash ads on the ground.
Raising head, I see Mr. Zuckerberg's face upon the sky.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 28, 2018

Artists create art masterpieces.
Scientists figure out how these masterpieces can be created in a scientific way.
Engineers make everyone capable of creating those masterpieces.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 30, 2018

A quick way to know how many aperture stops between fa and fb:
- Pick the smaller number as fa
- fa*2*n (n=1,2,3...) until the number...
Case 1) Equal to fb: 2n stops
Case 2) Exceed fb: 2n-1 stops
Ex:
Case 1) f2 to f16, n=3, 2n=6 stops
Case 2) f2.8 to f8, n=2, 2n-1=3 stops

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 31, 2018

The biggest lie: Read and Accept this Terms and Conditions.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 4, 2018

"From 2000 to 2005, software testing on Windows Phone, Android, and iOS." 🤔

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 11, 2018

Two rules of testing:
1) NEVER send a person to do a machine's work.
2) NEVER send a machine to a real person's work.

— Tim Ottinger (@tottinge) April 12, 2018

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: October 2017 - December 2017
item.description:
I feel so good that our scrum board doesn't have a column called "to test". The beauty is that testing can happen anytime. #30daysoftesting

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 30, 2017

4 levels of Testing Inception:
Real World
Cloned Replicated World
Simulated Parallel World
Mocked Fantasy World

Go deeper, don't be stuck.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 2, 2017

My 1st #testbash experience was really amazing! Great talks, awesome testers, nice location, decent food... See u next time 😘👊 #oktobertest

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 6, 2017

The quickest way to complete a task is to not start it at all.
Effectiveness > Effeciency

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 12, 2017

The main purpose of software testing is to provide effective information in order to increase ppl's knowledge of products under development.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 18, 2017

I'm a quick learner, but not a good student.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 18, 2017

😂 Next time when someone sends me an e-note & I spot something wrong in big chunks of code, I will put comment in that e-note: "Go fork it!"

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 20, 2017

A Good decision is usually not the perfect one. But it has to be made by considering & accepting clearly all possible risks at that moment.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 23, 2017

Mark Twain said: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you preorder iPhone X.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 27, 2017

You can still test without requirements @michaelbolton #TestBash pic.twitter.com/vzqxtw3IYb

— Cassandra H. Leung (@Tweet_Cassandra) October 27, 2017

Face ID testing should be very interesting: virtual 3D face, wearing glasses, wearing mask, twins, dog face, cat face and Arya.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) October 31, 2017

A Machine Learning algorithm walks into a bar.
The bartender asks, "What'll you have?"
The algorithm says, "What's everyone else having?"

— Chet Haase (@chethaase) November 1, 2017

Well said by @Snowden that's why everyone should care about the right to privacy. pic.twitter.com/OXnaYy2fHA

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 4, 2017

What? You found a silver bullet which can solve all problems? I doubt 🤔 How about use that bullet to shot me as I'm your new problem now.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 7, 2017

🌟 . * . 🌙
*
* . 🛰️ . ✨ *
. *
Thanks @Twitter, we can
always use more space 🚀
. . .
. * 🌏 *
🌞
* ☄️#280characters

— NASA Goddard (@NASAGoddard) November 8, 2017

The essence of agile is not building up technical debt. An important part of it is taking the time to refactor as you go. 4

— Alan Cooper (@MrAlanCooper) November 9, 2017

Releasing Firefox Quantum is like the declaration of a new browser competition. As a user, I don't really care who is the winner. The exciting thing is to see the performance boost of current browsers during the competition. Eventually, as judges, we'll get better browsers.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 15, 2017

On the train, a young mother and her son pass by my seat. Her bag is dropped by accident and her stuff go to everywhere on the carpet. I help her to collect them: a book, a wallet, a teddy bear... and a bottle of beer.
That's why I love this country.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 17, 2017

Business is Busyness.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 21, 2017

What a 🔥 day! It must be related to my first step walking into the office building this morning. Unusually, it was left.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 22, 2017

A sexy IT team should have 0 QA and everyone likes doing testing.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 23, 2017

Creative people get bored more easily.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 26, 2017

Nowadays the speed of data collection leads people to making wrong decisions based on these data more efficiently.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 27, 2017

Nowadays ML stands for "Machine Learning" everywhere. I miss the good old days when ML simply means "Making Love".

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) November 28, 2017

BEFORE
"Oh, you're working in IT industry. Can you help to fix my PC?"

NOW
"Oh, you're working in IT industry. Can you tell me should I buy Bitcoin now?"

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) December 5, 2017

To customers, automated checks ensure critical functionalities work;
To team, CI saves time in build process. Team may use saved time to discover or fix other problems;
To business, CI helps to deliver products efficiently & reduce customer feedback loop, fail fast fail often.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) December 8, 2017

P in IoT stands for Privacy.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) December 24, 2017

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: May 2017 - September 2017
item.description:
"USB sounds like a backup​ in case the USA fails" 😂https://t.co/Wma4Buitof

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 1, 2017

Sometimes an expected bad practice could bring an unexpected good result.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 2, 2017

Don't judge a (face)book (user) by its cover (image).

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 5, 2017

Saw a meme: Locks car keys in house, house keys locked in car... 🤦‍♂️

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 10, 2017

2b || !2b ?#makemyday

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 22, 2017

Spiders 🕷️ are skilled web 🕸️ developers. They develop web to catch bugs 🐞.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) May 28, 2017

Project risk: Sth blocks product delivery
Product risk: Sth causes building product wrongly
Business risk: Sth leads to build wrong product

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 1, 2017

You have to think really hard to get a simpler truth.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 2, 2017

"Internet Of Things is when your toaster mines Bitcoins to pay off its gambling debts to the fridge.” by Andrew Miller

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 6, 2017

If left brain is always right, then right brain had already left. 🤔

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 6, 2017

"E" letter stands for "extremely slow". For example: edge connectivity, IE browser and E2E tests...

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 6, 2017

Zero width space is pure evil 😈 pic.twitter.com/eyZPL9DSgV

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 13, 2017

I'd say I'm a 📙 reviewer. Before publish, read it carefully, think if stories are interesting to readers, give quick feedback to authors...

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 19, 2017

If you go to Japan, you don't really need to speak Japanese. You can communicate with people there using Ruby.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 19, 2017

Last time, my doctor googled things in front of me... I told myself at least he can tell which search result is wrong.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 21, 2017

“Make it correct, make it clear, make it concise, make it fast. In that order.” - Wes Dyer

— Programming Wisdom (@CodeWisdom) June 22, 2017

A decent #crash report "Cat sitting on keyboard crashes lightdm" To replicate: place keyboard on chair. Sit on it https://t.co/ozneylwFDc

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 23, 2017

One extra spicy meal makes you suffer twice.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 23, 2017

Code refactoring is like room cleaning. Daily small task. Nothing should change from outside of the house. No broken wall, no new 🏊 pool.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 23, 2017

10 yrs ago ppl ask me: how old are you? It means how young I am.
Now when ppl ask me the same question, I know it really means "how old"...

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 26, 2017

🕵️‍♂️😕
🤔😇🙅‍♂️🤔😈🙅‍♂️😵☹️
🤔🙅‍♂️🤔🙅‍♂️🤔🙅‍♂️...
☕...
💡😱🤔😨🤔🤓🤔😶🤷‍♂️#reproduce #edgecase

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) June 29, 2017

Dude’s Law: V = W / H
V is #value
W is #why (intent)
H is #how (mechanics/process)https://t.co/LRosRMQZO7 by @davidhussman

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) July 4, 2017

"We cling to memories as if they define us, but what we do defines us".

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) July 13, 2017

"Estimating" unknown unknowns is "guessing". If it's a number estimation, the answer is 42.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) July 19, 2017

A "manager", who is not able to get a whole overview of the things what (s)he is managing, is just "man" or "ager".

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) July 25, 2017

"How to be successful" is a vague question. To be successful "as" what and "at" what is the explicit question to think about.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) July 26, 2017

Ellison's Law: the larger the licensing fees for a product, the larger the pain for operations the product will be.

— journey to business value (@sadoperator) August 7, 2017

Amazing talk on Psychological Safety by @JoshuaKerievsky and @heidihelfand. Thank you both! #agile17 #ModernAgile pic.twitter.com/CEILBuuaRD

— Jefim Piekarz (@jefimpiekarz) August 8, 2017

Sam looked at his book draft. He crossed out the title "A Song of Ice and Fire" then wrote down "The Awareness of Global Warming"
~Fin~ #GoT

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) August 10, 2017

"We are soooo Agile but we don't see any improvement in TTM." Really?! Guess why? pic.twitter.com/zEIvmU9aCV

— Klaus Leopold (@klausleopold) August 13, 2017

"You want him to think big. Give him something big to think about."

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) August 21, 2017

Perceptions of probability and numbers as a joyplot. #datavizhttps://t.co/ksYA5tFaFk pic.twitter.com/v2sVHncRdC

— Randy Olson (@randal_olson) August 25, 2017

At least, now they are easier to use than all-in-one microwave... pic.twitter.com/cf4OpFS5fh

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) August 30, 2017

Some ppl are really stubborn. They follow rules strictly. They're afraid of losing control & power. But they don't know Agility is a ladder.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) August 31, 2017

QA is a job title, often a noun, sometimes a verb... My rule of thumb if word "f*ck" can replace it & ppl still understand, then it's clear. https://t.co/htw248jBy0

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 4, 2017

A good sprint is like a rollercoaster ride: you feel excited, nothing can stop you, the ride looks risky but you're confident in its safety.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 5, 2017

Up in the air, above the thick dark clouds, here comes the ☀

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 9, 2017

A boy asks his mother how he can be Batman. Mother says "You must be rich first." I have to correct her "Your boy must be parentless first."

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 11, 2017

His laptop has id scanner & screen protector. He types password slowly with 2 fingers in public.
Security isn't only tech, it's awareness.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 27, 2017

84 characters. I'm translating, not trolling... pic.twitter.com/NIbUHMPpiC

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) September 27, 2017

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: January 2017 - April 2017
item.description:
Bug <-> Debug
Test <-> Detest

Is that a kind of coincidence?

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) December 30, 2016

1. 🎥: 👯🐇💨🚶㊙🚪🐈🐛👒🍵👸👰👑♠♥♣♦😴

2. 📺: 🐺🐯🐲💮🐙🐟... 👑❤💔🔞🔥💥🔪... 💀😱💀💀😱😱💀💀💀😶💀💀💀💀💀...

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 4, 2017

Declare variables not war,
Get bugs fixed not mindset.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 14, 2017

A tool for work:
20 years ago, a tool is a tool.
10 years ago, a tool is a software.
5 years ago, a tool is a website.
Now a tool is an app.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 15, 2017

Dear DEVils,
During my absence, you're authorised to use my tool for testing purpose. Any abuses are welcome.
Happy testing!
Xoxo, TESTERia pic.twitter.com/yNht8lnPDG

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 25, 2017

A good news without "but" is a perfect good news.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 30, 2017

"In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is." 😉

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) January 31, 2017

"Wisely and slowly; they stumble that run fast."

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 2, 2017

Best practice only exists for someone at certain period of time. Not everyone, not always.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 14, 2017

🤣 true https://t.co/6S8jT0ZkX6

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 15, 2017

Oh I'm capable of suffering all small revertable changes & working on piece by piece, in order to make the world a better place🙏 #AgilityGod

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 17, 2017

Testing is not about finding bugs. It's about exploring unknown area, resolving ambiguity and leaning new things. 1/2

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Like holding a troch to light up the road in darkness, you could clearly see the way to go, make a map, and mark thorns and flowers. 2/2

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Checking is not about finding bugs. It's about verifying expectation, feeling confidence of working things and killing time. 1/2

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

Like holding a map in daylight, you're guided to avoid known obstacles, confident of your ability and ready for the next journey, again. 2/2

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) March 20, 2017

🤷 let me guess it's a part of How to reduce cost and assure phone call quality. ISTQB = I Swear That's Quite Boring

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 1, 2017

Junior XXX: I want a job even it's shitty
Senior XXX: I don't want a shitty job, no!
Expert XXX: I want to do some shitty things as my job 😉

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 11, 2017

Agility stops when HiPPO starts.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 13, 2017

Certification is a decent purchase invoice. https://t.co/QgXh9a6aaF

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 22, 2017

Tester's self-cultivation 3 Nb&b:
Not Become negative, Be motivated;
Not Block process, Be supportive;
Not Blame ppl, Be accountable.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 25, 2017

yolocity: the rate of #yolo occurrence.

— 𝙠𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙣 . (@KevCui) April 28, 2017

item.title: Tweet Pinboard: June 2016 - December 2016
item.description:
1/4 How does #QA prevent defects? My opinion is "Not really". Similar to how to prevent sickness?

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

2/4 Right release & #QA processes, like good habits, are necessary but not sufficient. Some unexpected virus can still break immune system.

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

3/4 Instead of preventing deflects, #QA should be able to point out issues as early as possible and figure out the risks as well.

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

4/4 Still not convinced by my opinion? Ok, I got another one in my mind:
- How does #QA prevent defects?
- All men must die!

— @KevCui June 8, 2016

1/2 The definition of #Quality is clear in the dictionary. When it's related to a product in reality, it becomes very ambiguous.

— @KevCui June 18, 2016

2/2 I need rethink about:
- Quality is for whom?
- How good quality is good enough for a release?
- How to measure the #Quality?

— @KevCui June 18, 2016

"Deploying a Broken Application Faster Will Not Make It Any Less Broken" Actually it's a good point 🤔 https://t.co/bjImS2Wuz9

— @KevCui June 23, 2016

If you have the power to make people disappointed. Please use it on me now.
If you don't use it on me, I will be disappointed. Would you?

— @KevCui June 28, 2016

Give you 10 more minutes, you will work more efficient? #WhatAbout
Give you 10L more gasoline, you will drive faster?

— @KevCui July 8, 2016

DAY 12: PROBLEM != PRO BLAME #30daysoftesting pic.twitter.com/49SWRzYb9y

— @KevCui July 12, 2016

To whom & my actions during dev:
A sophisticated dev, question why
A reliable dev, discuss how
A careless dev, reminder what#QAThought

— @KevCui August 3, 2016

Q: Who's ur exploratory testing idol?
A: Christopher Columbus
Q: Cause he found America?
A: No I like to punish local ppl as he did #BadJoke

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

If I blame ppl for their mistakes, I would keep blaming myself endlessly...

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

M: Inside every man there is a little boy.
F: How about women?
M: I don't really understand them, do you?
F: ... #BadJoke

— @KevCui August 8, 2016

Trustworthiness
Enthusiasm
Seeking
Thoughtfulness
Efficiency
Rationality #MakeATester

— @KevCui August 10, 2016

As a tester, I should provide as much information as I can and point out as many risks as I can, so that a correct decision can be made.

— @KevCui August 15, 2016

0 min nothing works
